snippet: A $1.2 million donation from Steve Tisch, an owner of the N.F.L. team, will pay to have trainers or emergency medical technicians at all contact practices for New York City’s public high schools.
abstract: Steve Tisch, chairman and part owner of New York Giants, gives $1.2 million to pay to have trainers or emergency medical technicians at all contact football practices for New York City public high schools; hope is to better identify signs of head injuries and concussions and city plans to continue program after initial funding runs out.
lead_paragraph: A $1.2 million donation from Steve Tisch, an owner of the N.F.L. team, will pay to have trainers or emergency medical technicians at all contact practices for New York City’s public high schools.

headline.main: Gift From Giants Chairman to Help School Football Programs Respond to Head Injuries
headline.print_headline: School Football Teams Get Money for E.M.T.s
